meanings.sent1: She was preexempting certain items from the new policy.
meanings.sent2: The company was preexempting certain employees from the mandatory training.
meanings.sent3: By preexempting the snacks, she ensured she wouldn't run out during the movie night.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking in preexempting the issue saved them from a major crisis.
meanings.sent5: Preexempting the chores allowed them to enjoy a relaxing weekend.

meanings.definition: To grant an exemption before it is required.
meanings.sent1: The school was preexempting students from the final exam due to exceptional performance.
meanings.sent2: The government was preexempting certain businesses from paying taxes for the first year.
meanings.sent3: By preexempting the parking fee, they made the event more appealing to attendees.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness in preexempting him from the punishment touched his heart.
meanings.sent5: Preexempting the fee encouraged more people to participate in the program.
